gave this a go as everyone and their uncle seemed to be looking at it after jacksepticeye covered it and i have to say it needs work, i understand it was probably made on a budget as this is a free title from the bbc your license fee well spent lol. but the resolution is bad and why wouldn't you use the grip controls to grip stuff have they even played any vr content before making this. this game is so dum dont bi it

Home could have been an remarkable free app for VR if they did 3 things:
 • Better optimization > I've got an i7 8700K - GTX 1080 - 64Go Ramn - 1To SSD NVME4 and it lag non stop !!! 
 • Interaction > you grab nothing, just a simple grab animation where you really feel you've got an object in the hand, wouldn't have take longer in dev, but it would have been far more greater for the user experience
 • Lifetime > it's too short, even for a free app, if we could  travel all the ISS with informations and differents place to repair, it could be an 2 hours long game, but here, even with the lag, it only take 10mn to finish it :(

Worst VR experience of my life, this is why people say VR is dying.

I will rate it a 5 due to it's good mechanics from what i saw.

this game had so much potential but the way it automatically moves your sight is the only thing thats ever given me motion sickness in my life...

This game is amazing, but very challenging. I had to do 7 tries to beat it on astronaut mode. The massege behind this game is also wonderful: "Why do we fight against ourselves, when we could build something beautiful like the ISS".

its a great game but i think it just to short plz make a number 2 of this game beacuse i like it the fisix are well done all tho im not sure but i think its imposable to acully live on the end of it or it is just realy hard but i realy do recomend it.
I got a little dizzy, but it was worth it. Also the game NEEDS a part 2.

Motion sickness aside (as VR causes this for almost everyone in the beginning)

I've been playing VR for a few months and decided to try this out. I found the controls and movement to be clunky and my character would randomly move away from the grab point as I was holding on to them. You're stuck in a 180degree viewing bubble. 

Imagine this as a Disney World ride along where you just kinda exist while things happen around you and you interact a little.

For the sake of adding info, I didn't complete the game. I died at the end where I was supposed to get back to the ship. Once it spit me back in the beginning I found it not worth my time to try again.

However, it's neat if you want to see what it's like on a space station.
They could have done things way better, and everything makes everything not realistic and you wanna vomit 24/7 its really bad believe me
AWESOME GAME WOULD DEFINITLEY RECOMMEND ALTHOUGH, It tries to warn me when I click astronaut mode, has anyone tried astronaut mode, and if so is it Ok?
In general is ok but prepare to suffer a high level of motion sickness.

Glitch and wonky. I have RTX 2080 and most other games play good on my pc but this game is just off. It won't track my movement correctly, it is like my physical arms are in one place but in the game it's somewhere else all stretchy and awkward. Also why are the view so limited to only what the game let you see. I can't see behind me. I have no real control of anything, i know this is not like a sandbox but come on...
got a headache, dizziness, and almost fell down... good game
it's this game but better

I've seen multiple reviews on people complaining on how they die at the end. First of all, you need to successfully steer back to the ISS on your own to save yourself. The people who say that they die at the end clearly did not beat the challenge. This game is filled with loops and twirls and as oculus says, Its not for regular or first-timers. This is a game that can cause heavy motion sickness if you're prone to it. The graphics aren't amazing but it is really something. It is pretty short so give it a go if you have time to waste and you aren't prone to motion sickness.

If you're a space enthusiast and want to get a VR impression of the size of the ISS, this is certainly worth a look. But be aware: Some scenes might cause heavy motion sickness! 
Definitely not the right choice for one of your first VR experiences tho. Try it when you're a little more experienced.

review_title: Pretty neat, but a bit nauseating.
one_reviews_text: Controls aren't great, but is ultimately worth the experience. Not for weak stomachs though! (Lots of spinning)

review_title: worst vr game i have ever played
one_reviews_text: very crappy game
They need to fix the joy stick movment.
If you have motion sickness this is not for you.  Worth every second playing in a space environment.
No italian language.. and after 2 min experience stop. Moreover you feel vomiting for the bad movements... me, my wife, my family same.. deleted immediately.
The story is like 1 minutes and its very disappointing, just dont download its a wast of time! (You cant even move freely in space you are guided by some walls.)

Ok.....to start, if I'd actually paid for this I'd be pissed.  Really pissed.  Since it was free I'm only gently pissed because they only wasted my time, but it was a worthwhile learning experience.  

I like the spacewalk and interactive nature of it all, I like the fact that there's some interaction b/w yourself and your EVA partner.  But the controls are clunky at best when hand-holding around the ISS, and don't even get me effing started when you go tumbling.

I get this is a cheap/free app; but holy hell, how hard would it be to include JUST ONE clickable link explaining the BASICS of manouvering in space??  There's literally nothing in the "Real Astronaut" mode, and in the beginner mode it's just "Point your hands at the target and squeeze the triggers".

What?

What the hell?

You should at the LEAST have some control over going forward and backward.  If it's there, I didn't friggin see it.

Look, it's worth the time to crawl of the ISS for 10 minutes if you literally have nothing else to do with your day.  Otherwise, hit up Mission ISS and explore to your hearts content.  It's paid for, but worth it.  

This was worth it for the lessons learned but not much else.  It's not a complete waste, but I can't recommend it with a clear conscience.
or is it me

Worth a play as an interesting experience. 
Controls aren't the best but still gives a worth will experience and you can always get your money back on this free app.

Yes, it is an experience, but not a pleasent one. First, you can't make any screenshots. I think the graphics are ok. The controlls are hard and it doesn't grab to the bars that well. Motion sickness is quite high. BUT you die in the end. It's not a good advertisment.

While yet to get a full gamut of VR experiences, the fact that this one is rated as intense and I managed to stick with it, for me, that's achievement unlocked!
It was quite dizzying in places, a feeling I have had before, after consuming more of the devils lettuce than my current tolerance is worthy.
It's short, it's free, it's difficult to complain too much, but ultimately I felt this was a bit of a let down and could have been so much more.
the hatch wont open i attatch the hook and everything but the hatch wont open and i cant push it open

People rating this kind of "experience" as anything more than one star is why VR is in such a dire state today.

I literally have nothing positive to say. Graphically, this is way below par compared to other VR titles. The Earth is low-res pixellated rubbish, and there is no sense of awe whatsoever on embarking on your spacewalk. The controls are pretty dire, somehow failing to provide a decent grab-and-pull-to-move experience despite it being such a simple movement system. Then there's the section that leaves you spinning uncontrollably in space for a minute or two, which will make any other than those with the strongest stomaches physically ill.

And then there's the "story", if you can even call it that. Go through an airlock, be totally underwhelmed at what "space" looks like, spin in space for a minute or two, then die. Wow. That was really worth my time and taught me so much about the ISS, what the astronauts on it actually do, and how they feel about it. (Actually, it didn't. That was sarcasm, for those that didn't notice.)

I know it's free and for that reason I wasn't expecting too much. However, this fell way short of even the limited expectations I did have. Do yourself a favour, dear reader, and avoid this waste of space. (Pun intended.) There are other far, far better space-based "experiences" available that are also free of charge. Get those instead.

Most horrible VR experience ever. After playing “Lone Echo” is “BBC Home” the stone age of VR and space walks. The hand rail grab and pull function is wonky and do not work as expected - why has the developers not fixed this yet?! This was the first time I got the VR motion sickness so bad I had to sit down so not to fall over. This demo has a lot of potential to be a very cool VR space walk but the mundane repair on the IIS turned out to be a horror ride. Never I get back to it again. Have uninstalled it after the first try.

A fun short romp that could probably use a bit more game design clarity, especially on the one (literally) off rails portion of the game. I will say, as someone with pretty sturdy VR legs, there is a Gravity moment that was pretty dizzying for a second :)

I love the work they put into the assets, but not every game has to be about space disasters. I'd honeslty just play a game where you have to float around the ISS making mundane repairs. It's not something I expect I'll ever get to do in real life, and that's exactly what VR is best at.

review_title: Two stars for effort - VR sickness tho
one_reviews_text: Cool to move around the space station - but tons of uncontrolled camera movement makes it very nauseating / uncomfortable. The earth model is really low-res as well.

So, at first I thought you just die no matter what. I played it three times! you don't die, almost in a real world situation if you're spinning in space you have no view around you and you need to be VERY aware of your surroundings! on The 3rd try I was able to get back to the air hatch! I wanted to test this theory of mine. To see if this is just a game that you die in no matter what. I tell you it's not the case. you can get back to the air hatch. You need to have good logic an awarness of your surroundings, quick critical thinking skills and most importantly, clalmness. you can get back. in the real world with out the proper training you're screwed. In this simulated enviomrent, you can achieve this!

I made it to the hatch but I couldn't grad on the rails and then I froze to death in about 20 seconds which I'm pretty sure doesn't happen irl. If I paid for this, I'd be mad but since it's free, I'm just disappointed that it didn't live up to it's true potential. ps. i finnis so if u fidn gremmar errors i not care

Really feels like your in space, clambering about on the space craft.

cool for the first minute the hand rail grab and pull function was crap and the last minute was scary af but the worst part is when i was able to get back to the space station hatch with the jet pack you die any ways like WTF not worth any ones time ima go play a good game

For free program this is the best VR spacewalk i ever felt .

gimme more plz, don't mind paying for a full one
It's a very cool game I enjoyed every moment I recommend it
Trash, lasts like 20 seconds, no clipping on the spaceship, so you just fly through the model, boring and poor graphics. Don't waste the bandwidth downloading.

I absolutely loved playing this game but was really bummed when it ended so quickly. But it was free, so I can't complain. I would GLADLY pay money for a full game continuation of this, please make one!

It is a short but rewarding experience. The fact that it is free you can not go wrong with it. Surely the developers could have done better, yes. But it's not fair to complain so much about free content. It's nice.

This is fantastic. If it had a little more to it, it would be out of this world (pun intended). But for a free experience, thank you once-again BBC.  Message to others, if you haven't tried 1943 Berlin Blitz, then you are missing out.

Honestly I don't want to give it decent, but it is ok. The game is obviously poorly done. You can see inside of your arms and the grab function only works half the time. And I don't care that you put intense on your label, being spung around in circles for a minute straight before letting them propel will make anyone wanna throw up.

As one of my first dynamic VR experience with movement it was a very intense (almost fell down) and immersive experience. I do recommend some caution when going in astronaut mode straight away :)

Played Astonaut Mode and got to go on a space walk. No spoilers, but that was an intense experience! I wish you could grab on to the structure of the ISS like you could in the other ISS game made by Oculus Studios. I would recommend that game over this.
The image quality could be better. It haven't a full 360 vision. But worth a view.
Remember that scene from Gravity where Sandra Bullock is hurtling into the depths of space, spinning uncontrollably? Well now you get to experience that in VR! With super broken controls. *urp*
Its cool
Anyone complaining about the incapacity to look where you want is ''censured''. The helmet cant move, the head move inside the helmet ! C'MON!

You don't have any freedom to move, look or turn around, can't grab from anything more than the stupid yellow bars; can't move using the environment of the space ship and it's freaking annoying to be spinning like a dumb spinner  'til the guy tells you to use the joystick to move back to the ship; nothing more than an annoying bad tutorial where you're forced to see what they want you to see. It's 0/5 actually but I'm forced to give 1 star.
A fun insight into being an astronaught, a little buggy in places but you get the idea,
It won't even open

review_title: Really nice, although not much content
one_reviews_text: It is a very cool experience. It allows us to have a perspective of how astronauts move and see things around them. Some people complain about not being able to look around, which is not true. We can move our head but we are just limited by the spacesuit helmet which is usually also static in real life and this gives you a real perspective of what it is like. Would be nice to have more content, but it is a nice-to-try.

Short but effective experience. I only tried Astronaut mode and it was fun!
A nuanced way to express the growing dangers of man-made space debris to any  population of people living in orbit.
PS: the head-tracking in this is spot-on. Many of the geniuses who submitted this as a complaint in their reviews below apparently have never seen a real spacesuit. The helmet does NOT move at all... your head moves WITHIN the helmet. Geez Louise, folks. Read a book or something. ;)
Its a pretty cool experience.  I really wish there was more to it.
Very good to play.

Well, I don't like to be negative, but just don't force me into looking into a specific direction.. The motion... I am a regular to Echo Arena where I twist and turn and make salto's but get a dry mouth of laughing before i get motion sickness, but this app "forces" you to watch over to where they want and it's really really making me want to throw up. I made it till this end but only because I normally don't understand people who get "motion sickness" and wanted to know what they are feeling. If my kids ever swallow something toxic I'll make them play this game. 3/5 Would barf again.
It's an incredible experience
Mechanics not as good as a lot of others.
A really nice introduction to VR with not much to do but enjoy the experience. The only downside is that it is very short.

Well... it was fun in astronaut mode but then both touch controllers were useless. Unable to do anything, all buttons and both joysticks did absolutely nothing except draining my fuel. 

Secondly the immersion broke when I realized that I could not turn/rotate using the touch controllers - and you cannot grip/move unless you are *supposed* to do it.
Pretty fan-freakin'-tastic. A must play.

Only played it on astronught mode and it was very immersive. Not sure why people are complaining about the helmet because it is accurate how it does not move with your head or getting motion sick (which I did not get). Thats simply all part of the experience. Also, getting to the airlock and back to safety felt really good especially with the knowledge that there is no protocol for rescue after a loose astronaught fails to use SAFER to return to the ship... Good sim, need more of this... also the arm posing could use a little work but still looks nice.

I"m stil shaking!! This felt so real that I was yelling for my hubby to come save me! Stil not sure which mode to choose, I did not choose "Astronaut" mode first and now I'm too scared to go back in and even try it. If you are looking for a realistic immersive experience, this is IT. When I get my courage up, I'll retry it. But for now, MIssion Control, I'm standing by. On earth!
Its a pretty cool game but problem I had with it was I got motion sickness from it.  Thats why I only gave it 2 stars.  But if that won't bother you by all means try it.
Some sort of "lone Echo" for free. Well made. Detailed graphics und nice movment. Yes ZG movment. I like it very much. Play it seated.
Nice Experience!!!

The experience looks amazing and the 'story' seems realistic enough. However, most gameplay elements have been totally messed up. First, when you look around, the astronaut's helmet does not move, meaning you can only look forward which is the exact opposite of the point of VR. When you meet the other astronaut, all his actions where he comes in to contact with you mess up. He turn you, but is standing where you were a minute ago, not now for example. I did not get nauseous probably because I was not immersed at all. To conclude, this would be a good little video, but it makes a terrible game.

First off, my "helmet" did not track to my head at all. The rotation was completely locked which was just weird.  My arms were limited in how far they could go. The torso of the suit stuck out way too far. And the path this game takes just does not work in VR whatsoever.

Right, I'll stick this in Astronaut mode and go and try and fix the station. I've done some gaming I thought, I can handle it.
4/5 would die with a nice view of the Middle East again.

Excellently presented and totally immersive. It's probably as near as you would get to doing the real thing but... don't use it to demo VR to a newbie. Even the 'safe' option will have most people nauseous.  Maybe that's why the ISS guys train for so long. Minus 1 star as a warning!

review_title: A repetitive sim and VERY intense.
one_reviews_text: It's the same game played over and over. Nothing changes other than a small amount of actions you make. However, it is beautiful and extremely immersive. It is also VERY INTENSE. If you are subject to nausea and horrible dissorientation in a VR game... Oh... there is a point in the sim that can make you hurl.
Holy crap. This game was so amazing, no words to discribe this. Some people got motion sickness from this. But not me. This was fun.

Basically, this is very short and shallow compared to the the free Mission:ISS. You get a short spacewalk, story driven and mostly without any control. Grabbing handles feels simply wrong, not just because they use the wrong button for doing so. There seems to be really no degree of freedom in what you do. You grab a handle, then something scripted happens, you grab the next one, something scripted happens. I really appreciated the freedom of movement and the immersive feeling that you have in Mission ISS. Not to mention that the integrated video clips and mini-tasks in there give you more than 5 minutes of content. Here, don't expect more than a scripted half-circle around the ISS.
got sick right after playing and couldn't play vr for 2 days

Worst movement mechanics I have seen yet in a VR game. (You have a specific 'grip' button by your palm that is OBVIOUSLY used for making a fist/gripping....so they map the trigger button to grip! It just continues...)How could they get it so wrong when everyone else can manage this type of locomotion fine? Don't waste your time.

First, I know this is free so the 2 star rating.  However, I feel this app actually damages both the BBC name and the real science and work that are being done on the ISS by real astronauts.  From the BBC name one would expect real science details to be used here.  However this is not the case as the ISS here does not move realistically in space in relationship to the earth or the sun.  The ISS here apprear to be in geo synchronous orbit not moving above the land mass it is over.  While the sun then moves in relation to the real ISS's speed (about 16 times around the earth in 24 hrs).  This ends up making it look like the sun revoles around the earth way too quickly.  Lastly, the design decision to trade a real astronaut experience for a sci-fi/horror film ending where it is impossbile to make it back alive is just insulting to the end users.

This manages to be dull, nausea inducing, and cliché.
If you prefer exploring the station, inside and ouside, and actually learning things, try Mission:ISS.
Still I love space things so I put 1 extra star :)

Bad clunky controls. Basically they are trying to do the ISS demo/tech demo thing but they somehow made the controls not work. See, in the ISS version you have complete freedom of movement where as here your pulling yourself along by heavily predefined points you grip which sometimes don't quite match up to the visuals leading you to get stuck in certain sections. As such immersion is killed right from the start. Avoid.

review_title: Yes you can get to the airlock
one_reviews_text: So this game/experience is not perfect.  But it is pretty freaking fun to play along with the zero-gravity space simulation.  You're in the ISS (no, not ISIS) you know the International Space Station.  And you're an astronaut tasked with checking and photographing damage to the ISS from space debris.  ***Spoiler Alert* Something bad happens and you have to get back to the ISS from zero gravity in space *End Spoiler Alert*** The graphics are well done.  The voice acting is up to par.  What really sets this experience back is the controls.  Grabbing unto items feels odd and not quite right.  The controls on the joystick space jetpack are lackluster.  Still, you can get a happy ending.  I did on my first try.  And I had fun and will look forward to sharing this experience with family and friends.  It's a great seated experience to introduce family and friends to VR and get their 'VR legs', i.e. get used to VR without getting nausea by giving them something which may cause a little nausea.  I experienced no motion sickness as a VR veteran.  Worth the download.

Compared with Space station: ISS, i'd have to say that this program is lacking in so many ways. When I grabbed something, it was like my touch was off, so it didn't feel like i grabbed the handles. Same with grabbing equipment. I don't have this problem with space station:iss program. Also, when I tried to go back to the station, I hit invisible space "walls", and when I reached the station, I could not grab surfaces, but merely floated through them. I could not look down properly and see the tool belt.
Only issue is that its not truely 360 degress. you cannot see behind you. And yeah its nauseating but thats what I would expect in space.
sick after 5 minutes

I downloaded this simulation of spacewalking to go and exam and take photo of a damaged solar panel...it is quite easy (if you have played other space games such as 'Adrift'. Hence no motion sickness at all) I actually thought that this wasn't a simulation at first. I literally thought it was a real documentary by BBC TV with us onboard the real thing with real astronauts, it is not so. This was until I found it was a simulation - of a disaster in space as soon as you try to grab hold of the camera! Suddenly, you are in danger floating out into space as the camera ends up out in space out of your reach. The control try and get you back into the airlock after being thrown out into space. So as a simulation of spacewalking, they have to add in a disaster! I don't know what happens in real life up there in the real ISS, but would this really happen? Having said that, I think they added that into this simulation - as a 'game' to test your skills, so I do not know if anything else goes on if you succeed with your examination of the damaged panel. All in all, I have nothing to complain about despite it is a free download. Though, perhaps a hint of getting a feel of how an astronaut really works and lives in space is a must without adding on a 'disaster'? As my title says, not bad for a freebie! :)

Controls suck, I was having artifacts come through my helmet. Graphics are meh... main reason I bothered downloading. Then you have the super nausea it caused me. I tried ISS before and it was a little uncomfortable but not like this one. Minute into the game they go full alligator roll on you and start spinning the hell out of you. Took it off and uninstalled right then and there. Gets 2 star because it's free.

Not disorienting for me at all on astronaut mode, but controls never seemed to do what they were supposed to. Who'd have thought your arms didn't properly respond to your brain signals in zero-g? At one point you're supposed to take out a camera - when I opened my toolbox the camera launched out into space at high speeds. Don't know if it's supposed to do that. Then I had to jetpack back to the airlock. Made it to the airlock but I got stuck on some panel and the game didn't let me grab any handles to pull myself in and I died right in front of the airlock. Dumb.

Play Mission:ISS instead! - It might still make you motion sick but atleast you won't have the view shifted as dramatically. The view is locked horizontally in ISS, unless you choose to turn that off. 

So... the criticism is valid. Right when I got into the game I saw how this could potentially make people extremely motion sick. The camera is shifting a lot and you feel like you have little control over the situation. The grabbing doesn't feel great. The developers gotta have strong VR legs man... I don't get motion sick easily but the part when you get thrown out from the station and start tumbling around... I had to actually close my eyes. Even if it did have better motion, like Echo Arena or Mission:ISS, I still would not give this more than 1-3 stars. The game feels clunky. Also, it would be nice to grip with the grip button instead of the trigger, like in most touch titles. 

The developers have clearly not developed for VR before and they should have done some research. It would take me less then an hour to find the most common causes for motion sickness in VR. And why not look at other similiar experiences and see how they handle moving in space? Time to let out a big fat, MEH!
1/5 star

...graphics not that much, but it'll certainly is worth the download. I've done the space walk a couple of times and it is quite good. Be advised, it is INTENSE, and by that I mean it can get you feeling motion sick real fast so it's not for so called VR "newbies". Give it a try, if you like space, it's worth it, just don't mind the poor earth graphics.

This is a very nice little walk-through and it feels like being in space indeed. True, the game design and details are not as delicate as Echo or other professional games, but I think people are being too critical on this free trip BBC and developers provide.

The little meter was way too close to my face. It took me two minutes to figure out how to get out through the hole (I didn't even know if it was possible but I kept trying). I played the "easy" mode, but the camera view is rotating as soon as you grab something and pull, and that made me very naucious. It's a shame, because I love space and would've loved to play more. But rotating the camera... no can do.

The control is weird and even the hand pose is so off when I do grabbing. Floating box in the beginning collides with the environment and the white tube twists strangely, doesn't look realistic/match its real material at all. Can't even rotate your head to see what's behind. You'll just see weird black unknown stuffs blocking your view (I guess it's the inner side of your astronaut helmet? But still why we can't rotate our head and see what's behind us!???) What's worst!? They will spin your camera unexpectedly and rapidly. I have to quit it after 5 mins of suffering. It's a great demo if you'd like to make someone puke.

I don't even know where to start from. I am a developer myself and specifically a VR developer. There is a big list of things that we know we should not do as developers in VR. It's a basic set of rules that everybody agrees on and that everybody knows. With this experience is like if somebody sat down, looked through that list and implemented every single thing that should not be done in the application. I develop in VR, I play VR games and I quite used to VR experiences, I could not reach the end of the VR experience and for the first time I actually felt cyber sickness. Whoever made this, should really consider spending some time going through what are the basic best practices for VR experiences.
Surprisingly well made space walk sim. A few parts actually made me jump. Not the most visually outstanding, but still enthralling.
Nice!!

review_title: Nice Idea but not effective experience
one_reviews_text:
I deinstalled the game after my 3rd attempt going to the space station with my boosts.
1. attempt (pro) - hard to navigate but got near of the air lock as a invisible wall stopped me to go further
2-3rd attempts (novice) - same situaiton but now I steered with the direction of the sight. Boosting and let me flow in sequence to the airlock was not possible. out of fuel, dead.
--> boring! deinstalled.
ah, last remark, the iss is moving 17.000 miles per hour, why I can still see the tempest over britain. the global should moving no?

Why is this an essential? Why is the trigger grab and not the grips? Why is moving so clunky? Why is the spacesuit wrong? Why is the jetpack impossible to use?   Why does this have an overall score of 3 stars?

review_title: Not even close to top notch
one_reviews_text: I am a big fan of Lone Echo/Echo Arena and Mission:ISS. This looked promising, but it's so scripted and undeviating, and the controls so limited, that I uninstalled after doing it twice. Took maybe 10 minutes for both passes. Not really worth the download in my opinion. Problems include the following. Motion is entirely scripted - you can almost ignore the handholds and you still stay locked to the scripted path. You can’t grab but a couple items – everything else bounces away when you try. The “fly the spacesuit” bit seems (in my two tries) impossible and not physically likely – first I thought “I’ll save fuel by coasting”, but the timer keeps counting down when I’m not using fuel. And when I tried the second time to hurry and beat the timer, I got blocked from actually reaching my goal. You can’t turn your body at all – you can only turn your head within the locked-in-space helmet, so no way to look around or enjoy the experience. The “sunset” was soooooo faked it was silly. So yeah, pretty pictures, but I’d recommend either Lone Echo or Mission ISS for a much more realistic spacewalk and zero-g environment and experience.

I trusted the very positive early reviews and the BBC's reputation, but this experience is actually quite disappointing. It's rather nice to look at but the controls are terrible in comparison to similar apps, like Mission : ISS which starts basically the same but offers a much more intuitive and efficient grip on objects. Here I got bored after a couple of minutes, seeing my hands bent in impossible ways, having difficulties grabbing handles, while me and my companion's spacesuits kept intersecting the ISS like there's no collisions. Well, you can try it anyway since it's free. :\

This has a lot of potential, and the graphics are excellent. However the motion controls are not well mapped, and it's disorientating. Other apps (eg lone echo) have figured out the movement system with your hands much better than this, I wish they had followed best practice like that. Hopefully they fix the issues for a future version as it has lots of potential. Still, worth it at the (free) price

Try Mission ISS instead.. the movement, collision detection and all round polished nature feels far superior to this.. This is a hand holding, heavily scripted introduction to VR, very short and quite disappointing for something connected to the BBC. If it weren't for Mission ISS I think it would have felt more impressive. It does offer something that Mission ISS doesn't which is a fun 30-40 seconds which I won't give away hence 2 stars.

The idea and experience make it worth it, but the controls are useless! Grabbing and pulling forward is rubbish. That robo handball-game is SPOT ON with grabbing, pulling, pushing and floating through area's completely weightless. THIS IS NOT. And not able to rotate and look around is idiotic! What a shame!
Very Good

Such a cool take on VR.  Completely unique experience.  Pulling yourself out of the ISS airlock for the first time with Earth below you is breathtaking.  The sensation of weightlessness is surprisingly immersive. I played through this twiceback-to-back and did get mildly motion sick though, so be warned.

this was very disapointing, the motion did not match the actions perfectly, half of your visor is blacked out behind you where the developers couldent be bothered to create visuals for it, and overall very disapointing grabing. Grabing bars is so unrealistic and the locking point with movement are so bad. if you want to try a great space sim #1 would be ADR1FT and #2 would be Lone Echo. this  is a sham. and although its free, i feel cheated.

Yet another oh-ahh! Wow look outerspace VR experience, that is as empty and clunky as it is badly implemented (bugs). Oh yes and it literally spins you around, head over heels at one point, so good luck with that.

Last time I checked the ISS was not in a geostationary orbit so when it says you are orbiting the earth at 17000 miles an hour I actually expect to see the earth below to be moving. The starfield is appualing, random white pixels do not make a realistic space scene. The only saving grace was It was free.

I loved being in space with this app. However there is one scene where you spin out of control. I'm a veteran at VR but even I felt as if I was about to fall down. But the app developers had mentioned that could happen when I picked the 'advanced user' option in the menu. All in all, you should give this app a try if you like space VR apps.

Travel VR is another app which is similar to this one.

I do not really know why people are complaining, this app is free, what do people expect? You can not expect top notch everything when it is free.
By the way people it is free...

If you go in expecting a tour of the ISS, or something perspective expanding and educational, you're going to be sorely dissappointed. However, for what this is, it's mind blowingly good! It's not educational the way a lecture is, but they really put detailed attention into this game. The zero-G is downright amazing. Objects not only float, but have inertia. Furthermore, all the details are considered. For example, if you are touching the space station, you can hear the motors and equipment on the inside, but if you let go, well... SILENCE...

Truly a masterpiece, BBC has outdone themselves. But only if you know what to look for.

(PS - It's worth the one play through to see if you beat it the first time. I guarentee you won't!)

This title fails to deliver a good and convincing VR experience. Your hands and and arms just seem so off when you use them. There's a lot of clipping issues present here.
The "game" itself, if you can call it that is visually disapointing as well. Save your hard drive space and avoid this one.

This is what VR can do and more, if u get motion sickness.. question why u want VR and try a few other things before this.
This is a great intro into to being there in yr space..
Highly recommended and free too
I would pay for more of this type of VR sim

It's a real pain and a shame that developpers have not handled motion sickness at all. It's the first thing dev should think carrefully about for a VR application otherwise going into production is a pure waste of time. I'm used to using VR app for 3 years and I have had experienced here twice the worst severe motion sickness ever.  If devs or producers don't care about the motion sickness factor, it means they don't care about users. Therefore this app should be banned from the oculus store for this main reason. 
More over, the scenario is also a bad choice because it makes you feel like you are a failure. My first reaction : uninstall that crap at once.
NB: Mission ISS is far well beter handled if you like a good space station experience.

review_title: Not for everyone. Not done well.
one_reviews_text:
First thing first: Causing motion sickness  MUCH WORSE than Mission ISS. 
Grasp controls are very poorly done compare to Mission ISS. Althogh it actually has some story, which is nice, but it also puts you into a HELLA SPIN within the first few mins. If you have no problem with motion sickness, you might want to give it a go. But hey, it is obviously they failed on the interaction parts.

review_title: why not translate for other countries?
one_reviews_text:
There were no technical issues with running the app, as some people accuse. I use windows 10 and use with minimal hardware.
As for the application itself, why not translate or put subtitles for other countries, Portuguese Brazil or Spanish, for example? The world does not live around the US alone. Lack of consideration that. I would give 4 stars, but because of this fault of the language only English, then I will give 3 stars. The graphics and the immersion are reasonable, not bad, but could also be much better, 
although it is not possible to do miracle with the low resolution of the Rift Oculus.  There is not much excitement during the experience.

The graphics are okay, dialog is professionally done but a bit cheesy, movement is disconnected from Touch controllers a fair amount, animations are half-done, and the "Gravity" part is kind of dumb.  But since it's free, I'd recommend you give it a go anyway as long as you have some experience with VR and have motion sickness under control.

review_title: Why is the audio so darn loud?!
one_reviews_text: I had to turn the Oculus volume down to 10% to get it to a normal hearing level. And then I had to deal with the subpar controls to try and leave the ISS. The Interstellar VR Experience beats this, and all you do in that one is automatically float around!
Compared to echo arena this games mechanics are terrible. You can't even push off walls to move.

if they added more i would actually enjoy this a bunch
It's not worth money though at it's current state tbh
Below average graphics that fail portraying the setting and awe of being in space. I've experienced that awe in other vr apps. This one, not so much (none really). Horrible controls. waste of time
The only experience so far that makes me dizzy...
considering this is a free program i was satisfied with the experience. the fixed view was a little weird but i doubt spinning around is easy in a space suit.
Made me dizzy, but the sheer aspect and execution of dragging myself along the ISS, amazed me!
Try Mission ISS instead, this is really not that great.
Great Experience
awaful clipping issues, when they say that the astronaut mode is for advanced people only, they mean its motion sickness enducing. I recomend any other BBC made app, this one is awaful
Not as good as I thought it was going to be.

I get stuck in front of some huge bulky object and can't reach the hatch. Anybody else having the same problem? Apart from that, I guess it is a nice experience, yet quite nauseating at times. Some model errors that look weird, needs a little polishing.
Horrible experience, the most nauseating thing ive played since the launch of the rift.
I think they should make another one the physics are so good it is lit :)
The controls are just terrible. Got stuck on the intro.
This demo is awesome. It let's you feel like you are in space, and it does it while being super immersive. Me and my friends were shocked after playing this 10 minute game.
Such a pain in the a** to move.
Main complaints are length and the weird hand/arm tracking not matching where your hands actually are. Still a good looking experience though.
The effect of your entire body remaining completely stationary while the whole environment moves around you is nausiating, even on the easy mode.
like iiiit
Worth the download for sure. Hand controls aren't as responsive as Mission ISS but then you're very much more confined to the prescribed positions that go with the little story. Enjoyed it.
bruh
I'm amazed by this work. No game on this store was as immersive as this one
Everything is top but it was for me too dizzy xD
Lot's of bugs, crappy controls and motion sickness. If this would use the controls and tech of LoneEcho I would give it 5 stars. Ok, it's free...but don't pay for this.
The idea is very good, a trip on orbit.. The experience is too short and the graphics are not on the rendez-vous.
Controls lack responsiveness. Unlike Mission ISS (provides a much better experience overall), it doesn't feel like i'm truly grabbing the station.
Major let down on earth graphics quiality. I got a much bigger -in space- feeling from zooming out in google earth vr than from this, due to the textures being so poor.
that app is made on a terrible way, you got an all black visual on your back, the grab move is not accurate and giving a lot of sick.

review_title: A great first step for BBC
one_reviews_text: A short but great ride in a mind blowing experience. Would have give it 5 stars if controls were better.
Interesting concept, but motion made me feel super bad. I thought I could handle VR. Seems not :(

- Trigger for grip (it's vive game?)
- Aliasing
- No free move, astronaut move alone
- You can't turn to see back
- Colision bug
- Low quality
That was really cool, I tried it in Astronaut mode.  It would be cool if lots of scenarios were added.
It's a good way to introduce new people to (PC-VR). just warn them about motion sickness first before use!
Would be great if there was an option for subtitles please!!

review_title: Short but sweet for the iron guts
one_reviews_text: Do not play this game if you can't handle twisting in VR
Nauseating..looks ok though, cant really comment on the rest had to get out of there.
Been finding desperately non-touch contents and this wasn't marked I need one. So I can't really say anything, just that it has false description.
Quite an unexpected outcome, worked fine not too hard nor disorentating.
I expected more from a BBC production. Short and uninformative.
VERY good, but 1st thing to give me motion sickness!!!
Great experience, very immersive.
Won't start, error....OVR 75318303
is this all they could do with this subject matter. very poor . I guess its because its BBC related
Says something about Library Applications not allowed while in app and to close all programs but the only app running is Oculus Home.
